name: Herbal Shrimp Delight with Beer Sauce
author: Chris Warner
summary: Chopped tiger shrimp on a delicious blend of greens and herbs, drizzled with my own beer and tomato sauce!
ingredients: 1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: In a medium bowl, toss together basil, oregano, parsley, spinach, romaine lettuce, 3 tablespoons olive oil, and white wine
In a small bowl, blend the flour and water to a paste
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium high heat, and saute the onion, green onion, and garlic 5 minutes, until tender
Reduce heat to low, and blend in the flour and water
Mix in the beer and lime juice, season with salt and pepper, and simmer while cooking the shrimp
Heat remaining olive oil in a separate medium saucepan
Saute the shrimp about 3 minutes on each side, until opaque
Remove shrimp from heat, and finely chop while warm
Serve over the herb and greens mixture, and drizzle with beer sauce
Sprinkle with Parmesan and freshly ground black pepper
